1.name: Fee Type
1.description: Assign different Fee Types for payments.

2.name: Fee Type Category
2.description: A categorization code on which fee posting entries can be consolidated.

3.name: P&L Account definition
3.description: Select Profit and Loss (fee income) Account; from the Accounts profiles in GPP

4.name: Fee Formula
4.description: Customize the formulas by which fees are calculated for processed messages.

5.name: Fee Currency
5.description: Specifies the currency of the calculated fees.

6.name: External Fee System
6.description: GPP to initiate a call to an external fee system.

7.name: Deduct from (Payment/Account)
7.description: Indicate whether fees are to be deducted from payment amount or debited to an account.

8.name: Apply fees
8.description: Specify when the fee is to be charged: • Now: Both the fee calculation, and the actual posting, should take place with the message completion • Later: The fee calculation should take place and be displayed immediately, but the posting should take place later (i.e. skip posting). This is usually set for a billing option • Waive: The fee calculation should take place and be displayed immediately, but the posting will not take place. Having the calculated fee would be helpful to understand the amount of waived fees

9.name: Fee per (Advice/Payment)
9.description: Indicates whether the fee is per message or per the message and per each advice generated.

10.name: Method
10.description: set different ways in which the fees are calculated.

11.name: Request for Charges
11.description: Incoming Requests for Charges (MTn91) relate to payments that have been sent out by GPP with details of charge (SWIFT tag 71A) as OUR. The requests by the receiving institution include a claim for charges from the originator of the message.

13.name: Agent Fees
13.description: Assign Agent Fees to the message, when the Agent Fees are known.
